trans-unit.source: In order to receive money from app sales in the Windows Store, you need to set up your payout account and fill out the necessary tax forms.
trans-unit.target: In order to receive money from app sales in the Windows Store, you need to set up your payout account and fill out the necessary tax forms.

trans-unit.source: Setting up your payout account and tax forms
trans-unit.target: Setting up your payout account and tax forms

trans-unit.source: Setting up your payout account and tax forms
trans-unit.target: Setting up your payout account and tax forms

trans-unit.source: In order to receive money from app sales in the Windows Store, you need to set up your payout account and fill out the necessary tax forms.
trans-unit.target: In order to receive money from app sales in the Windows Store, you need to set up your payout account and fill out the necessary tax forms.

trans-unit.source: If you only plan to list free apps (and don't plan to offer in-app purchases), you don't need to set up a payout account or fill out any tax forms.
trans-unit.target: If you only plan to list free apps (and don't plan to offer in-app purchases), you don't need to set up a payout account or fill out any tax forms.

trans-unit.source: If you change your mind later and decide you do want to sell apps (or in-app products), you can set up your payout account and fill out tax forms at that time.
trans-unit.target: If you change your mind later and decide you do want to sell apps (or in-app products), you can set up your payout account and fill out tax forms at that time.

trans-unit.source: You won't be able to submit any paid apps or IAPs until your payout account and tax profile has been completed.
trans-unit.target: You won't be able to submit any paid apps or IAPs until your payout account and tax profile has been completed.

trans-unit.source: **Note** [Certain markets](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/jj863494) only allow you to list free apps.
trans-unit.target: **Note** [Certain markets](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/jj863494) only allow you to list free apps.

trans-unit.source: If your account is registered in one of these markets, you will not have the option to set up a payout account.
trans-unit.target: If your account is registered in one of these markets, you will not have the option to set up a payout account.

trans-unit.source: After you have [set up your developer account](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh868184), there are two things you need to do before you can sell apps (or IAPs) in the Windows Store:
trans-unit.target: After you have [set up your developer account](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh868184), there are two things you need to do before you can sell apps (or IAPs) in the Windows Store:

trans-unit.source: Set up your payout account
trans-unit.target: Set up your payout account

trans-unit.source: Fill out your tax forms
trans-unit.target: Fill out your tax forms

trans-unit.source: **Note** For details about how and when you will be paid for the money your apps make, see [Getting paid](getting-paid-apps.md).
trans-unit.target: **Note** For details about how and when you will be paid for the money your apps make, see [Getting paid](getting-paid-apps.md).

trans-unit.source: Payout account
trans-unit.target: Payout account

trans-unit.source: A payout account is the bank account to which we send the proceeds from your sales.
trans-unit.target: A payout account is the bank account to which we send the proceeds from your sales.

trans-unit.source: This bank account must be located in the same country where you registered your developer account.
trans-unit.target: This bank account must be located in the same country where you registered your developer account.

trans-unit.source: **Note** In some markets, PayPal can be used as a payment method.
trans-unit.target: **Note** In some markets, PayPal can be used as a payment method.

trans-unit.source: See [Account types, locations, and fees](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/jj863494) to find out if PayPal is supported for a specific market, and read the [PayPal info](#paypal) below for more details.
trans-unit.target: See [Account types, locations, and fees](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/jj863494) to find out if PayPal is supported for a specific market, and read the [PayPal info](#paypal) below for more details.

trans-unit.source: To set up your payout account
trans-unit.target: To set up your payout account

trans-unit.source: In the Windows Dev Center dashboard, and click **Account settings** in the left navigation menu.
trans-unit.target: In the Windows Dev Center dashboard, and click **Account settings** in the left navigation menu.

trans-unit.source: In the left navigation menu of the **Account settings** page, click **Payout account**.
trans-unit.target: In the left navigation menu of the **Account settings** page, click **Payout account**.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Because this is sensitive info, you may be prompted to sign in again.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Because this is sensitive info, you may be prompted to sign in again.

trans-unit.source: On the screen that appears, fill out the info for your account.
trans-unit.target: On the screen that appears, fill out the info for your account.

trans-unit.source: **Note** The fields you use to provide your account info accept only alphanumeric characters.
trans-unit.target: **Note** The fields you use to provide your account info accept only alphanumeric characters.

trans-unit.source: Save your info.
trans-unit.target: Save your info.

trans-unit.source: If you need to update or change your payout account, follow the same steps above, replacing the current info with the new info.
trans-unit.target: If you need to update or change your payout account, follow the same steps above, replacing the current info with the new info.

trans-unit.source: **Important** Changing your payout account can delay your payments by up to one payment cycle.
trans-unit.target: **Important** Changing your payout account can delay your payments by up to one payment cycle.

trans-unit.source: This delay occurs because we need to verify the account change, just as we did when you first set up the payout account.
trans-unit.target: This delay occurs because we need to verify the account change, just as we did when you first set up the payout account.

trans-unit.source: You'll still get paid for the full amount after your account has been verified; any payments due for the current payment cycle will be added to the next one.
trans-unit.target: You'll still get paid for the full amount after your account has been verified; any payments due for the current payment cycle will be added to the next one.

trans-unit.source: See [Getting paid](getting-paid-apps.md) for more info.
trans-unit.target: See [Getting paid](getting-paid-apps.md) for more info.

trans-unit.source: PayPal info
trans-unit.target: PayPal info

trans-unit.source: In select countries and regions, you can create a payment account by entering your PayPal info.
trans-unit.target: In select countries and regions, you can create a payment account by entering your PayPal info.

trans-unit.source: However, before choosing PayPal as a payment account option:
trans-unit.target: However, before choosing PayPal as a payment account option:

trans-unit.source: Check [Account types, locations, and fees](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/jj863494) to see if PayPal is a supported payment method in your country or region.
trans-unit.target: Check [Account types, locations, and fees](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/jj863494) to see if PayPal is a supported payment method in your country or region.

trans-unit.source: Review the following FAQs.
trans-unit.target: Review the following FAQs.

trans-unit.source: Depending on your situation, PayPal may not be the best payment account option for you, and a bank account may be preferred.
trans-unit.target: Depending on your situation, PayPal may not be the best payment account option for you, and a bank account may be preferred.

trans-unit.source: Common questions about using PayPal as a payment method:
trans-unit.target: Common questions about using PayPal as a payment method:

trans-unit.source: What PayPal settings do I need to have in order to receive payments?
trans-unit.target: What PayPal settings do I need to have in order to receive payments?

trans-unit.source: You must ensure that your PayPal account does not block eCheck payments.
trans-unit.target: You must ensure that your PayPal account does not block eCheck payments.

trans-unit.source: This setting is managed in PayPal’s Payment Receiving Preferences page.
trans-unit.target: This setting is managed in PayPal’s Payment Receiving Preferences page.

trans-unit.source: See [PayPal’s account setup page](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=513139) for more info.
trans-unit.target: See [PayPal’s account setup page](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=513139) for more info.

trans-unit.source: Is my country/region supported?
trans-unit.target: Is my country/region supported?

trans-unit.source: See [Account types, locations, and fees](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/jj863494) to find out where PayPal is a supported payment method.
trans-unit.target: See [Account types, locations, and fees](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/jj863494) to find out where PayPal is a supported payment method.

trans-unit.source: Is there a restriction on the size of payments that I can receive using PayPal?
trans-unit.target: Is there a restriction on the size of payments that I can receive using PayPal?

trans-unit.source: Yes.
trans-unit.target: Yes.

trans-unit.source: PayPal limits the amount of money that users can receive in a single transaction.
trans-unit.target: PayPal limits the amount of money that users can receive in a single transaction.

trans-unit.source: The limits vary by currency; see [PayPal’s transaction limit page](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=513108) for each currency’s limit.
trans-unit.target: The limits vary by currency; see [PayPal’s transaction limit page](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=513108) for each currency’s limit.

trans-unit.source: If you anticipate that you will receive a payment greater than your PayPal transaction limit, change your payment method to a bank account.
trans-unit.target: If you anticipate that you will receive a payment greater than your PayPal transaction limit, change your payment method to a bank account.

trans-unit.source: Does my PayPal account have to be registered in the same country/region as my Dev Center account?
trans-unit.target: Does my PayPal account have to be registered in the same country/region as my Dev Center account?

trans-unit.source: No.
trans-unit.target: No.

trans-unit.source: When you set up a PayPal account, you can accept the default configuration.
trans-unit.target: When you set up a PayPal account, you can accept the default configuration.

trans-unit.source: You shouldn’t have any issues with other countries/regions and currencies unless you have blocked payment in some currencies.
trans-unit.target: You shouldn’t have any issues with other countries/regions and currencies unless you have blocked payment in some currencies.

trans-unit.source: This setting is managed in PayPal’s Payment Receiving Preferences page.
trans-unit.target: This setting is managed in PayPal’s Payment Receiving Preferences page.

trans-unit.source: Do I have to accept PayPal payments manually?
trans-unit.target: Do I have to accept PayPal payments manually?

trans-unit.source: No.
trans-unit.target: No.

trans-unit.source: PayPal accounts are set by default to require users to accept payments manually, which means if you don’t accept the payment within 30 days, it is returned.
trans-unit.target: PayPal accounts are set by default to require users to accept payments manually, which means if you don’t accept the payment within 30 days, it is returned.

trans-unit.source: You can change this setting by turning off “Ask Me” in PayPal’s More Settings page.
trans-unit.target: You can change this setting by turning off “Ask Me” in PayPal’s More Settings page.

trans-unit.source: Specific requirements for certain countries/regions
trans-unit.target: Specific requirements for certain countries/regions

trans-unit.source: In some countries and regions, additional requirements for payout accounts must be followed.
trans-unit.target: In some countries and regions, additional requirements for payout accounts must be followed.

trans-unit.source: If you are a resident of Pakistan, Russia, or Ukraine, please note the following requirements.
trans-unit.target: If you are a resident of Pakistan, Russia, or Ukraine, please note the following requirements.

trans-unit.source: Pakistan
trans-unit.target: Pakistan

trans-unit.source: Form-R is a Pakistan banking regulatory requirement.
trans-unit.target: Form-R is a Pakistan banking regulatory requirement.

trans-unit.source: It is used to indicate the purpose and reason for receipt of funds from abroad.
trans-unit.target: It is used to indicate the purpose and reason for receipt of funds from abroad.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, anytime that you are eligible for a monthly payout from Microsoft, you will need to submit a Form-R to your bank before the payout can be released to your account.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, anytime that you are eligible for a monthly payout from Microsoft, you will need to submit a Form-R to your bank before the payout can be released to your account.

trans-unit.source: Contact your local bank branch for instructions on how to obtain a copy of Form-R.
trans-unit.target: Contact your local bank branch for instructions on how to obtain a copy of Form-R.

trans-unit.source: You will need to submit a Form-R to your bank each month that you are eligible for a payout.
trans-unit.target: You will need to submit a Form-R to your bank each month that you are eligible for a payout.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you expect to receive a payout every month of the year, you will need to submit a Form-R 12 times (once each month).
trans-unit.target: For example, if you expect to receive a payout every month of the year, you will need to submit a Form-R 12 times (once each month).

trans-unit.source: Once the payout has been submitted to your bank, you have 30 days to submit a Form-R.
trans-unit.target: Once the payout has been submitted to your bank, you have 30 days to submit a Form-R.

trans-unit.source: If it is not submitted within 30 days, the funds will be returned to Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: If it is not submitted within 30 days, the funds will be returned to Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: Russia
trans-unit.target: Russia

trans-unit.source: If you’re a developer who lives in Russia, you may need to provide documentation to your bank before your bank will deposit funds into your account.
trans-unit.target: If you’re a developer who lives in Russia, you may need to provide documentation to your bank before your bank will deposit funds into your account.

trans-unit.source: When you’re eligible to be paid, we will provide you with the following documentation in an email message:
trans-unit.target: When you’re eligible to be paid, we will provide you with the following documentation in an email message:

trans-unit.source: Certificate of Acceptance (CoA) – contains the amount of payout being transferred to your account.
trans-unit.target: Certificate of Acceptance (CoA) – contains the amount of payout being transferred to your account.

trans-unit.source: App Developer Agreement (ADA) – a signed copy of the developer agreement that needs to be counter signed.
trans-unit.target: App Developer Agreement (ADA) – a signed copy of the developer agreement that needs to be counter signed.

trans-unit.source: To ensure your payout is successful, please also keep in mind the following:
trans-unit.target: To ensure your payout is successful, please also keep in mind the following:

trans-unit.source: The **Account holder name** entered for your payout account in the Windows Dev Center dashboard must be the exact same name associated with your bank account.
trans-unit.target: The **Account holder name** entered for your payout account in the Windows Dev Center dashboard must be the exact same name associated with your bank account.

trans-unit.source: For example, if your bank account name contains a middle name, add a middle name to your **Account holder name**.
trans-unit.target: For example, if your bank account name contains a middle name, add a middle name to your **Account holder name**.

trans-unit.source: Payouts are transferred directly from Microsoft to your bank account in Ruble (RUB) currency.
trans-unit.target: Payouts are transferred directly from Microsoft to your bank account in Ruble (RUB) currency.

trans-unit.source: Bank information entered in Dev Center in Latin characters is translated to Cyrillic characters.
trans-unit.target: Bank information entered in Dev Center in Latin characters is translated to Cyrillic characters.

trans-unit.source: Payouts must be made to a bank account and not to a bank card.
trans-unit.target: Payouts must be made to a bank account and not to a bank card.

trans-unit.source: Ukraine
trans-unit.target: Ukraine

trans-unit.source: If you’re a developer who lives in Ukraine, you may need to provide documentation to your bank before your bank will deposit funds into your account.
trans-unit.target: If you’re a developer who lives in Ukraine, you may need to provide documentation to your bank before your bank will deposit funds into your account.

trans-unit.source: When you’re eligible to be paid, we will provide you with the following documentation in an email message:
trans-unit.target: When you’re eligible to be paid, we will provide you with the following documentation in an email message:

trans-unit.source: Certificate of Acceptance (CoA) – contains the amount of payout being transferred to your account.
trans-unit.target: Certificate of Acceptance (CoA) – contains the amount of payout being transferred to your account.

trans-unit.source: App Developer Agreement (ADA) – a signed copy of the developer agreement that needs to be counter signed.
trans-unit.target: App Developer Agreement (ADA) – a signed copy of the developer agreement that needs to be counter signed.

trans-unit.source: Amendment Agreement (AA) – this document can be used by your bank to help identify your payout funds.
trans-unit.target: Amendment Agreement (AA) – this document can be used by your bank to help identify your payout funds.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft provides all three documents when your first payout is attempted.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft provides all three documents when your first payout is attempted.

trans-unit.source: For any subsequent payouts, you will only receive the CoA document.
trans-unit.target: For any subsequent payouts, you will only receive the CoA document.

trans-unit.source: Please retain the ADA and AA documents in case you need them to receive future payouts from your bank.
trans-unit.target: Please retain the ADA and AA documents in case you need them to receive future payouts from your bank.

trans-unit.source: To ensure your payout is successful, please also keep in mind the following:
trans-unit.target: To ensure your payout is successful, please also keep in mind the following:

trans-unit.source: The **Account holder name** entered for your payout account in the Windows Dev Center dashboard must be the exact same name associated with your bank account.
trans-unit.target: The **Account holder name** entered for your payout account in the Windows Dev Center dashboard must be the exact same name associated with your bank account.

trans-unit.source: For example, if your bank account name contains a middle name, add a middle name to your **Account holder name**.
trans-unit.target: For example, if your bank account name contains a middle name, add a middle name to your **Account holder name**.

trans-unit.source: Payouts are transferred directly from Microsoft to your bank account in USD currency.
trans-unit.target: Payouts are transferred directly from Microsoft to your bank account in USD currency.

trans-unit.source: Bank information entered in Dev Center in Latin characters is translated to Cyrillic characters.
trans-unit.target: Bank information entered in Dev Center in Latin characters is translated to Cyrillic characters.

trans-unit.source: Tax forms
trans-unit.target: Tax forms

trans-unit.source: After you have [registered for a developer account](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh868184) and set up your [payout account](#receiving_payments), you can create your *tax profile* for the Windows Store by completing the following steps:
trans-unit.target: After you have [registered for a developer account](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh868184) and set up your [payout account](#receiving_payments), you can create your *tax profile* for the Windows Store by completing the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Specify your country of residence and citizenship.
trans-unit.target: Specify your country of residence and citizenship.

trans-unit.source: Fill out the appropriate tax forms.
trans-unit.target: Fill out the appropriate tax forms.

trans-unit.source: You can complete and submit your tax forms electronically in your dashboard; in most cases, you don't need to print and mail any forms.
trans-unit.target: You can complete and submit your tax forms electronically in your dashboard; in most cases, you don't need to print and mail any forms.

trans-unit.source: **Important** Different countries and regions have different tax requirements.
trans-unit.target: **Important** Different countries and regions have different tax requirements.

trans-unit.source: The exact amount that you must pay in taxes depends on the countries and regions where you sell your apps.
trans-unit.target: The exact amount that you must pay in taxes depends on the countries and regions where you sell your apps.

trans-unit.source: See the [App Developer Agreement](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh694058) to find out for which countries Microsoft remits sales and use tax on your behalf.
trans-unit.target: See the [App Developer Agreement](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh694058) to find out for which countries Microsoft remits sales and use tax on your behalf.

trans-unit.source: In other countries, depending on where you are registered, you may need to remit sales and use tax for your app sales directly to the local taxing authority.
trans-unit.target: In other countries, depending on where you are registered, you may need to remit sales and use tax for your app sales directly to the local taxing authority.

trans-unit.source: In addition, the app sales proceeds you receive may be taxable as income.
trans-unit.target: In addition, the app sales proceeds you receive may be taxable as income.

trans-unit.source: We strongly encourage you to contact the relevant authority for your country or region that can best help you determine the right tax info for your Windows Store developer activities.
trans-unit.target: We strongly encourage you to contact the relevant authority for your country or region that can best help you determine the right tax info for your Windows Store developer activities.

trans-unit.source: To complete your tax profile
trans-unit.target: To complete your tax profile

trans-unit.source: In the Windows Dev Center dashboard, click **Account settings** in the left navigation menu.
trans-unit.target: In the Windows Dev Center dashboard, click **Account settings** in the left navigation menu.

trans-unit.source: In the left navigation menu of the **Account settings** page, click **Tax profile**.
trans-unit.target: In the left navigation menu of the **Account settings** page, click **Tax profile**.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Because this is sensitive info, you may be prompted to sign in again.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Because this is sensitive info, you may be prompted to sign in again.

trans-unit.source: Review your current tax profile status and click **Edit** to complete the required forms.
trans-unit.target: Review your current tax profile status and click **Edit** to complete the required forms.

trans-unit.source: Answer the questions about United States citizenship and residency, then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Answer the questions about United States citizenship and residency, then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: If your name and address info are displayed, confirm them for the purposes of filing taxes.
trans-unit.target: If your name and address info are displayed, confirm them for the purposes of filing taxes.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will see electronic versions of the tax forms that you must complete.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will see electronic versions of the tax forms that you must complete.

trans-unit.source: Regardless of your country of residence or citizenship, you must fill out United States tax forms to sell any apps or in-app products through the Windows Store.
trans-unit.target: Regardless of your country of residence or citizenship, you must fill out United States tax forms to sell any apps or in-app products through the Windows Store.

trans-unit.source: Developers who satisfy certain United States residency requirements must fill out an IRS W-9 form.
trans-unit.target: Developers who satisfy certain United States residency requirements must fill out an IRS W-9 form.

trans-unit.source: Other developers outside the United States must fill out an IRS W-8 form.
trans-unit.target: Other developers outside the United States must fill out an IRS W-8 form.

trans-unit.source: You can fill out these forms online as you complete your tax profile.
trans-unit.target: You can fill out these forms online as you complete your tax profile.

trans-unit.source: A United States Individual Taxpayer Identification Number (or ITIN) is not required to receive payments from Microsoft or to claim tax treaty benefits.
trans-unit.target: A United States Individual Taxpayer Identification Number (or ITIN) is not required to receive payments from Microsoft or to claim tax treaty benefits.

trans-unit.source: Withholding rates
trans-unit.target: Withholding rates

trans-unit.source: The info you submit in your tax forms determines the appropriate tax withholding rate.
trans-unit.target: The info you submit in your tax forms determines the appropriate tax withholding rate.

trans-unit.source: The withholding rate applies only to sales that you make into the United States; sales made into non-US locations are not subject to withholding.
trans-unit.target: The withholding rate applies only to sales that you make into the United States; sales made into non-US locations are not subject to withholding.

trans-unit.source: The withholding rates vary, but for most developers registering outside the United States, the default rate is 30%.
trans-unit.target: The withholding rates vary, but for most developers registering outside the United States, the default rate is 30%.

trans-unit.source: You have the option of reducing this rate if your country has agreed to an income tax treaty with the United States.
trans-unit.target: You have the option of reducing this rate if your country has agreed to an income tax treaty with the United States.

trans-unit.source: Tax treaty benefits
trans-unit.target: Tax treaty benefits

trans-unit.source: If you are outside the United States, you may be able to take advantage of tax treaty benefits.
trans-unit.target: If you are outside the United States, you may be able to take advantage of tax treaty benefits.

trans-unit.source: These benefits vary from country to country, and may allow you to reduce the amount of taxes that the Windows Store withholds.
trans-unit.target: These benefits vary from country to country, and may allow you to reduce the amount of taxes that the Windows Store withholds.

trans-unit.source: You can claim tax treaty benefits by completing Part II of the W-8BEN form.
trans-unit.target: You can claim tax treaty benefits by completing Part II of the W-8BEN form.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you communicate with the appropriate resources in your country or region to determine whether these benefits apply to you.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you communicate with the appropriate resources in your country or region to determine whether these benefits apply to you.
